segment.source: Prerequisites for Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)
segment.target: Prerequisites for Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)

segment.source: There are a few prerequisites for using Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: There are a few prerequisites for using Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Prerequisites for Windows Store for Business
segment.target: Prerequisites for Windows Store for Business

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: There are a few prerequisites for using Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: There are a few prerequisites for using Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: You'll need this software to work with Store for Business.
segment.target: You'll need this software to work with Store for Business.

segment.source: Required
segment.target: Required

segment.source: IT Pros that are administering Store for Business need a browser compatible with Store for Business running on a PC or mobile device.
segment.target: IT Pros that are administering Store for Business need a browser compatible with Store for Business running on a PC or mobile device.

segment.source: Supported browsers include: Internet Explorer 10 or later, Microsoft Edge, or current versions of Chrome or Firefox.
segment.target: Supported browsers include: Internet Explorer 10 or later, Microsoft Edge, or current versions of Chrome or Firefox.

segment.source: Employees using apps from Store for Business need Windows 10, version 1511 running on a PC or mobile device.
segment.target: Employees using apps from Store for Business need Windows 10, version 1511 running on a PC or mobile device.

segment.source: Microsoft Azure Active Directory (AD) accounts for your employees:
segment.target: Microsoft Azure Active Directory (AD) accounts for your employees:

segment.source: IT Pros need Azure AD accounts to sign up for Store for Business, and then to sign in, get apps, distribute apps, and manage app licenses.
segment.target: IT Pros need Azure AD accounts to sign up for Store for Business, and then to sign in, get apps, distribute apps, and manage app licenses.

segment.source: Employees need Azure AD accounts when they access Store for Business content from Windows-based devices.
segment.target: Employees need Azure AD accounts when they access Store for Business content from Windows-based devices.

segment.source: If you use a management tool to distribute and manage online-licensed apps, all employees will need an Azure AD account.
segment.target: If you use a management tool to distribute and manage online-licensed apps, all employees will need an Azure AD account.

segment.source: For more information on Azure AD, see About Office 365 and Azure Active Directory, and Intro to Azure: identity and access.
segment.target: For more information on Azure AD, see About Office 365 and Azure Active Directory, and Intro to Azure: identity and access.

segment.source: Optional
segment.target: Optional

segment.source: While not required, you can use a management tool to distribute and manage apps.
segment.target: While not required, you can use a management tool to distribute and manage apps.

segment.source: Using a management tool allows you to distribute content, scope app availability, and control when app updates are installed.
segment.target: Using a management tool allows you to distribute content, scope app availability, and control when app updates are installed.

segment.source: This might make sense for larger organizations that already use a management tool.
segment.target: This might make sense for larger organizations that already use a management tool.

segment.source: If you're considering using management tools, check with the management tool vendor to see if they support Store for Business.
segment.target: If you're considering using management tools, check with the management tool vendor to see if they support Store for Business.

segment.source: The management tool will need to:
segment.target: The management tool will need to:

segment.source: Integrate with the Windows 10 management framework and Azure AD.
segment.target: Integrate with the Windows 10 management framework and Azure AD.

segment.source: Sync with the Store for Business inventory to distribute apps.
segment.target: Sync with the Store for Business inventory to distribute apps.

segment.source: Proxy configuration
segment.target: Proxy configuration

segment.source: If your organization restricts computers on your network from connecting to the Internet, there is a set of URLs that need to be available for devices to use Store for Business.
segment.target: If your organization restricts computers on your network from connecting to the Internet, there is a set of URLs that need to be available for devices to use Store for Business.

segment.source: Some of the Store for Business features use Windows Store app and Windows Store services.
segment.target: Some of the Store for Business features use Windows Store app and Windows Store services.

segment.source: Devices using Store for Business – either to acquire, install, or update apps – will need access to these URLs.
segment.target: Devices using Store for Business – either to acquire, install, or update apps – will need access to these URLs.

segment.source: If you use a proxy server to block traffic, your configuration needs to allow these URLs:
segment.target: If you use a proxy server to block traffic, your configuration needs to allow these URLs:

segment.source: login.live.com
segment.target: login.live.com

segment.source: login.windows.net
segment.target: login.windows.net

segment.source: account.live.com
segment.target: account.live.com

segment.source: clientconfig.passport.net
segment.target: clientconfig.passport.net

segment.source: windowsphone.com
segment.target: windowsphone.com

segment.source: .wns.windows.com
segment.target: .wns.windows.com

segment.source: .microsoft.com
segment.target: .microsoft.com

segment.source: .msftncsi.com/ncsi.txt
segment.target: .msftncsi.com/ncsi.txt
